title: Finance Coordinator
summary: The role of a Finance Coordinator in a Non-Government Organization (NGO) is critical to ensuring the smooth financial operations and compliance with funding regulations. A Finance Coordinator in an NGO must be detail-oriented, analytical, and knowledgeable about financial management practices. They should also possess strong communication skills to work effectively with various stakeholders within and outside the organization. It is a Permanent-Type Position.

title: Roles
summary: Financial Planning and Budgeting, Expense Management, Audit and Compliance, Financial Controls, Financial Planning and Forecasting, Training and Capacity Building, Grant Proposal Support.

subsections.title: Financial Planning and Budgeting
subsections.content: Collaborate with the management team to develop and implement the organization's financial plans and annual budgets. Monitor budget adherence and provide regular reports on financial performance.

subsections.title: Financial Reporting
subsections.content: Prepare timely and accurate financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements. Present financial data to management and other stakeholders as required.

subsections.title: Grants and Funding Management
subsections.content: Oversee the financial aspects of grants and funding received by the NGO. Ensure compliance with funding requirements and reporting guidelines set by donors.

subsections.title: Expense Management
subsections.content: Monitor and control expenses to ensure efficient use of resources. Review and approve expenditures, ensuring they align with the approved budget and are supported by proper documentation.

subsections.title: Bookkeeping and Accounting
subsections.content: Maintain accurate financial records, including transactions, receipts, and invoices. Ensure all financial activities are recorded in the accounting system in a timely manner.

subsections.title: Audit and Compliance
subsections.content: Coordinate with auditors during the annual financial audit and implement necessary adjustments based on audit findings. Ensure compliance with relevant financial and tax regulations.

subsections.title: Financial Controls
subsections.content: Establish and maintain internal financial controls to safeguard the NGO's assets and prevent fraud or misuse of funds.

subsections.title: Donor and Stakeholder Communication
subsections.content: Act as a point of contact for financial-related queries from donors, board members, and other stakeholders. Provide financial updates and reports as required.

subsections.title: Financial Planning and Forecasting
subsections.content: Collaborate with program managers to support financial planning for new projects and initiatives. Conduct financial forecasting to assist with resource allocation decisions.

subsections.title: Financial Policy Development
subsections.content: Develop and implement financial policies and procedures to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of financial operations.
